channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-6824] Introduce ${hbase.local.dir} and save coprocessor jars there
item.description:
We need to make the temp directory where coprocessor jars are saved configurable. For this we will add hbase.local.dir configuration parameter.

Windows tests are failing due to the pathing problems for coprocessor jars:
Two HBase TestClassLoading unit tests failed due to a failiure in loading the test file from HDFS:


testClassLoadingFromHDFS(org.apache.hadoop.hbase.coprocessor.TestClassLoading): Class TestCP1 was missing on a region

testClassLoadingFromLibDirInJar(org.apache.hadoop.hbase.coprocessor.TestClassLoading): Class TestCP1 was missing on a region

The problem is that CoprocessorHost.load() copies the jar file locally, and schedules the local file to be deleted on exit, but calling FileSystem.deleteOnExit(). However, the filesystem is not the file system of the local file, it is the distributed file system, so on windows, the Path fails.
item.summary: Introduce ${hbase.local.dir} and save coprocessor jars there

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: HBASE-6842 is related.
Attaching patches for trunk and 0.94.

Both patches fail to apply for me.

What do you think about making the directory for local jar temp storage separately configurable to java.io.tmpdir (but defaulting to its value)?

Good idea. Hadoop has a mapred.local.dir, to manage local files. We can introduce hbase.local.dir, and default to $java.io.tmpdir/hbase/. Then we can save coprocessor jars under $hbase.local.dir/tmp/ or $hbase.local.dir/coprocessor/jars/.
Sounds good Enis.

Updated the patch with Andrew's suggestion.

  • Added hbase.local.dir conf options
  • HBTU sets this so that the local dir is inside test-data dir
  • coprocessor jars are put under $ {hbase.local.dir}

    /coprocessor/jars/
Changed the issue title and description according to the discussions and the patch. Andrew, could you please take a look at this.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12547025/hbase-6824_v2-trunk.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 6 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

-1 javadoc. The javadoc tool appears to have generated 149 warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to introduce 8 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:

Thanks for review Andrew. Rebased the patch. Will commit if passes hadoopqa.
Note to self: add a release note on commit.

This message is automatically generated.
Committed v3 to trunk. Thanks for review Andrew.
I would like to get this in 0.94 as well. It does change the location of where coprocessor jars are saved though. Not sure whether this breaks BC. Any comments Lars Hofhansl?

We copy the coprocessor jar locally so it can be loaded by the JVM, schedule it for deletion at exit, and then ignore it. Moving from one locally r+w location to another is something to note for ops, but not a backwards compatibility concern.

Integrated in HBase-TRUNK #3716 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK/3716/)
HBASE-6824. Introduce $

{hbase.local.dir}

and save coprocessor jars there (Revision 1431081)

Result = FAILURE

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Added a configuration "hbase.local.dir" which defaults to ${hbase.tmp.dir}/local/. Coprocessor jars, and other local data for region servers are written to this location.
